result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrius D Murphy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: COURT DOES NOT OBJECT TO THIS SENTENCE BEING TRANSFERRED TO THE STATE OF ILLINOIS

miscConds.notes: $239.95 to be paid to the Winnebago Credit Union, JOINT AND SEVERAL with Sharlon Garrett (15CF1513). Cash bail applied.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, to be collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages, during any period of ES. To be paid by the end of probation. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered. Cash bail applied.

- Seek/maintain full-time employment.
- Obtain high school diploma or GED.

- No illegal drugs.
- No controlled substances without valid prescription.
- No Contact with drug community.
- No Contact with the victim Machele F., any Buckle Store in the State of Wisconsin. Contact with the co-actor Sharlon Garrett at the Probation Agent's discretion.

- Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens. No positive results.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet
Bail Refund Packet

Defendant Darrius D Murphy in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Darrius D Murphy in custody.   Student Intern Kathryn Ginsberg under the student practice rule supervised by Assistant District Attorney Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for  48 days days time served. 

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:  

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered defendant to serve 60 condition days in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the vicitm Machele F. any Buckle Store in the State of Wisconsin, contact with the co-actor Sharlon Garrett at the Probation agent's discretion.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $239.95 to be paid the the Winnebago Credit Union, joint and several with Sharlon Garrett 15CF1513.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages, during any period of ES.  To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

The Court does not object to this sentence being transferred to the State of Illinois.  

The Court does object to expungment.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Filed.

Defendant Darrius D Murphy in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Defendant Darrius D Murphy in custody.  Student Intern Kathryn Ginsberg under the student practice rule supervised by Assistant District Attorney James C Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.    Defendant is proceeding with a projected guilty plea.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Bail to remain.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court, defendant Darrius D Murphy not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Court now in trial as a result of a spin speedy trial taken from Branch 30.     Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defense counsel requests reduction in bail.  The Court did not deny defense's motion but required him to provide additional information to the state regarding defendant's in custody status from June 11, 2015 through May 19, 2016.

Attorney Matt Last for Andrew R Rider in court, defendant Darrius D Murphy not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defense counsel newly appointed requests scheduling date.    Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court, defendant Darrius D Murphy not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informed the Court, defendant was extradited from Illinois and believes he did not turn himself in.
Email to the Public Defender's Office to have new counsel appointed for warrant return date.  Case calendared for warrant return on May 25, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.

Matter before the Court for Plea hearing.  Defendant not present.  Defense indicates that the defendant is still in custody in Cook County (IL).  State's motion to lift stay on bench warrant heard and granted.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
